intro: Mesembryanthemum hesperanthum, commonly known as the evening daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers open in the late afternoon and close at dawn, a trait that gives it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
